awd_titl_txt: Student Support: 2022 Manufacturing Science and Engineering Conference and 50th North American Manufacturing Research Conference; West Lafayette, Indiana; June 27-July 1, 2022
awd_abstract_narration:
This award supports approximately 80 selected graduate and undergraduate students studying at U.S. institutions to participate in the co-located conference event consisting of the 2022 International Manufacturing Science and Engineering Conference (MSEC) sponsored by the American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) Manufacturing Engineering Division (ASME/MED) and the 50th North American Manufacturing Research Conference (NAMRC) sponsored by the North American Manufacturing Research Institution of the Society of Manufacturing Engineers (NAMRI/SME). These are world-class conferences in the manufacturing engineering fields involving conventional and emerging manufacturing technologies, manufacturing systems including quality control and reliability, advanced materials processing, data-driven manufacturing innovations (e.g., applications of machine learning and artificial intelligence), and sustainable manufacturing with life cycle engineering, etc. As such, MSEC and NAMRC uniquely act as global bridges between industries, government laboratories, and academic institutions. This award provides student participants with opportunities to exchange ideas with leading researchers and engineers from industrial and governmental facilities around the world, as well as with students and faculty from both domestic and international universities. In addition to nurturing a global manufacturing vision, participants will learn about the latest research and developments in manufacturing engineering.

The project will provide selected students with support for conference registration and accommodation. The call for student support applications will be disseminated through postings on main conference websites, announcements through conference organizers, track chairs, and symposium organizers, and direct communication with students involved in poster session, manufacturing design competition and research presentation competition. The submitted applications will go through a selection process by the conference committee. The eligibility criteria to receive the funding include the following: (1) students must be from U.S. institutions and (2) students must be actively participating in the conference through presenting a paper, a poster, or participating in a competition. Students from the underrepresented groups are strongly encouraged to apply. The list of student awardees will be announced in the conference program. This award will enable selected student participants to improve their knowledge of manufacturing technologies and help them become engineers and researchers to lead the next generation of U.S. manufacturing.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation

por.por_cntn:
This award supported 76 selected graduate and undergraduate students to participate in the co-located conference event consisting of the 2022 International Manufacturing Science and Engineering Conference (MSEC) sponsored by the American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) and the 50th Annual North American Manufacturing Research Conference (NAMRC) sponsored by the North American Manufacturing Research Institution of the Society of Manufacturing Engineers (NAMRI/SME). This event was hosted by the College of Engineering of Purdue University, and held in West Lafayette, Indiana, on June 27 - July 1, 2022.

The NSF travel grant was announced on the webpages of SME NAMRC, ASME MSEC, and the NAMRC/MSEC host. ASME and SME also sent emails to the MSEC and NAMRC communities. The application deadline was March 1, 2022 with 129 full applications received by the deadline; the notifications to the recipients went out on March 19, 2022. The award covered each recipient’s registration fee and lodging expenses (up to 4 nights) in the Purdue Residence Hall Housing.

Among the 76 student recipients, 36 were from underrepresented groups (including 28 female,9 Hispanic/ African American, 3 with disability) and 7 students were participants of the ASME/SME Student manufacturing design competition.

The student recipients were able to attend two premier manufacturing research conferences. They were exposed to the latest research findings in their area(s) of interest. Furthermore, they were able to interact with top researchers in the manufacturing field, listen to plenary keynote talks each day, hear industry-specific talks, and attend technical tours.

The supported students also attended the Early Career Forum on June 29, 2022. Eleven panelists with experience in academia, government/national labs, and industry provided information about various research and technical positions. They presented an overview of their careers and participated in a roundtable discussion on how to be successful in industry, academia, and government/national labs.


Last Modified: 12/01/2022
Modified by: Barbara S Linke
